review_text: The Trail of Faith Ranch was a wonderful place to stay a few days and enjoy the peaceful and natural surroundings. It is less than 10 miles west of Interstate 45, between Corsicana and Ennis, TX. Susie and Doug are excellent hosts; Susie spent time with us to answer our many questions about the ranch's animal residents and the ranch operations. She took us to meet their Longhorn herd and that was a great visit with many photo opportunities. We were provided fresh eggs for breakfast and homemade banana bread to sample. Overall I give it a solid 4. Maybe 4.5. Here is why I didn't give it a 5.
1- there is no TV. I know it says no TV in the ad, but it's 2022, even if streaming only I want a TV. Even if it's for local news or white noise while we go to bed. Board games can't put me to sleep.
2- It's dark outside the entry door at night. The neighborhood isn't the nicest, so we would pull up get out quick and go in and lock the door. I'd recommend a bright or brighter exterior light on the front and rear doors to the unit.
3- If you sleep downstairs on the couch and are a light sleeper, you will hear trains all night, ask me how I know. Once again not a fault of the host, she was great, but I heard trains multiple times at night.
Listen, once you are inside the unit it's great, comfy and cozy. So if you are like us, we couldn't find a hotel and needed a place to stay for the night, then this is your place. If you are looking for a place with outdoor areas to hang out and enjoy, maybe not so much. For what it was and is and we needed, it's great. Just needs a couple of mimor things to be a 5 star. (like make sure the air vents are open upstairs or you will be like me sleeping on the couch down stairs hearing trains all night only realizing the next morning why it's so hot upstairs is because someone shut the air vents. Also one of the dmok detectors was missing a battery and the detector was open, might snug those up next time)
It does have a full kitchen, comfy couch, breakfast table and bund beds which my kids liked. Also has a washer and dryer.

review_text:
Similar to other reviewers, we opted for this listing instead of a hotel, and feel like we got much more for our money here and were able to have a comfortable stay.
We stayed for almost an entire week and found we had almost everything we needed to comfortably live in the air bnb without multiple trips to the store or having to eat out nightly.
This listing was very comfortable for our family of four, but could have easily slept three more. Kitchen had all necessary appliances and most cookware we would need. Beds were comfortable and living area spacious with two private bedrooms (bunk beds at the top of the stairs were great for our two young children.) There is a gated courtyard for kids to run around in with a large pecan tree for shade.
This location is in downtown Corsicana, literally one street away from an HEB grocery store and blocks from historic downtown. Don't forget to go to the famous Collin Street Bakery just minutes away!
Church bells from the beautiful church across the street charmed us during the day, although our nearness to the fire and police department did mean we had some siren noises at night.
This listing felt safe for our family and as we come to town again to visit relatives, this will be our first check for availability for our accommodations.

* * * * * BOTTOM LINE UP FRONT * * * * *
Vermin in the unit and an indifferent property manager - I will never return, nor can I recommend this location
AirBNB had to step in in order to resolve this case appropriately - They were very professional and I sincerely appreciate their expert assistance
Resolution was:
- Full refund of 2 nights lodging
- Payment of the cleaning and additional fees
- Definitely fair
* * * * * DETAILS * * * * *
First impression was a great one - Nice, quirky and generally comfortable little place - Reminded me of traveling in Europe.
Access to the unit was efficient - Communication with the owner was easy.
* * * * * INITIAL PROBLEM: BARKING DOG * * * * *
Neighbor's dog barking in a neighbor's yard right in back of the unit until 1:30am - Very loud; sounded like it was right on the other side of the wall - Not the owner's fault, but it did impact my stay
* * * * * LARGER PROBLEM: VERMIN IN THE UNIT * * * * *
Shocked awake at 2:30am by an insect crawling on my leg, under the covers. Jumped up, turned on the light and saw a large cockroach next to the bed - Which I immediately killed. Sleep for the rest of the night was near impossible, as a result.
As I went to shower in the morning, I saw another cockroach - But that one escaped under the baseboard before I could kill it.
While leaving, a third cockroach appeared between the bedroom and the bathroom - This was the largest of the three I saw - I stomped that one to death and left both cockroach corpses in place when I departed.
I reported the problem to the owner that morning. She assured me she would be having an exterminator visit but didn't seem overly concerned, saying every house in the area had them (due to the heat), but added "we them water bugs" - Which I felt really trivialized the gravity of having cockroaches in a lodging unit.
Candidly, it doesn't matter what you call them - "Water Bugs" or Cockroaches - Who wants to wake up to one crawling on their leg? NOBODY!
* * * * * FINAL PROBLEM: INTERACTION WITH THE OWNER * * * * *
The next day I asked the owner if she planned to do anything to make the situation right before I submitted this review.
I felt having a positive response from her included in the review should temper the negatives a bit, and I wanted to give her another chance to respond positively.
She wanted to know what I thought was fair - I wanted to see what she thought was right without prompting from me, and I told her so.
She didn't understand and apparently got the impression I was trying to "extort" her (she clearly doesn't know what that word means) and told me so. She also said the conversation was "getting weird" and refused to continue the discussion.
This owner seems hyper-focused on control measures and takes great pains to focus on rules for her rental. It's unfortunate she's not as motivated to provide good customer service.
I gave the owner a chance to respond in a positive manner, but she either didn't understand, or just wasn't interested - So take that as you will.
* * * * * BOTTOM LINE * * * * *
Vermin in the unit and an indifferent property manager - I will never return, nor can I recommend this location
AirBNB had to step in in order to resolve this case appropriately - They were very professional and I sincerely appreciate their expert assistance
JR

It was a bit nauseating if I’m being honest. Once I try to make dinner The oven would not preheat. I left it to preheat for over an hour and it did not get hot. So my guess and I were forced to use the microwave In order to cook our food. The toilet has a sound that is quite loud! It would start up on its own minutes after flushing and continue to make loud noises that woke my guests. This was an adequate place to stay for ONE NIGHT ONLY. I personally don’t think i could’ve stayed longer than that. For the price I would’ve expected all functioning appliances. Also the “outside staircase” should actually be labeled an emergency exit as it should only be used in emergencies ONLY. It was flimsy and felt unstable. The spiral staircase is NARROW so take that into consideration.
On a personal note: I was made to feel uncomfortable by the MULTITUDE of questioning I received from the host about why I wanted to take a vacation on my birthday. I completely understand them wanting to protect their property and their space. However there is a right way and a wrong way to go about questioning someone, and based off of my experience they did it the wrong way and it rubbed me the wrong way. For me personally, The questioning I received in combination with the experience that I had once there, is not, nor was not worth the price point. Furthermore, I’d advise future guests to be mindful when booking this property that they WILL heavily question you on your intentions. The bed was comfortable enough though and I’m grateful for them allowing us to stay, regardless of being disappointed by the experience.
